text: In those days Hezekiah was stricken with a terminal illness. The prophet Isaiah son of Amoz visited him and told him, “This is what the Lord has said, ‘Give your household instructions, for you are about to die; you will not get well.’”
He turned his face to the wall and prayed to the Lord,
“Please, Lord. Remember how I have served you faithfully and with wholehearted devotion, and how I have carried out your will.” Then Hezekiah wept bitterly.
Isaiah had not yet left the middle courtyard when the Lord’s message came to him,

“Go back and tell Hezekiah, the leader of my people: ‘This is what the Lord God of your ancestor David has said: “I have heard your prayer; I have seen your tears. Look, I will heal you. The day after tomorrow you will go up to the Lord’s temple.

I will <st data-num="03254" class="">add</st> <st data-num="02568 06240">fifteen</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> your <st data-num="03117" class="">life</st> and <st data-num="05337" class="">rescue</st> you and <st data-num="02063" class="">this</st> <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> <st data-num="03709" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0804" class="">Assyria</st>. I will <st data-num="01598 05921">shield</st> <st data-num="02063" class="">this</st> <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> <st data-num="04616" class="">for the sake of</st> my reputation and <st data-num="04616" class="">because of</st> my promise to <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> my <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st>.”’”<n id="1" />
Isaiah ordered, “Get a fig cake.” So they did as he ordered and placed it on the ulcerated sore, and he recovered.
Hezekiah had said to Isaiah, “What is the confirming sign that the Lord will heal me and that I will go up to the Lord’s temple the day after tomorrow?”
Isaiah replied, “This is your sign from the Lord confirming that the Lord will do what he has said. Do you want the shadow to move ahead 10 steps or to go back 10 steps?”

<st data-num="03169">Hezekiah</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">answered</st>, “It is <st data-num="07043" class="">easy</st> for the <st data-num="06738" class="">shadow</st> to <st data-num="05186" class="">lengthen</st> <st data-num="06235" class="">10</st> <st data-num="04609" class="">steps</st>, but <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> <st data-num="06738" class="">it</st><n id="1" /> to <st data-num="07725" class="">go</st> <st data-num="0322" class="">back</st> <st data-num="06235" class="">ten</st> <st data-num="04609" class="">steps</st>.”
Isaiah the prophet called out to the Lord, and the Lord made the shadow go back ten steps on the stairs of Ahaz.
At that time Merodach Baladan son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent messengers with letters and a gift to Hezekiah, for he had heard that Hezekiah was ill.

<st data-num="02396" class="">Hezekiah</st> <st data-num="08085 05921">welcomed</st><n id="1" /> them and <st data-num="07200" class="">showed</st> them his <st data-num="03605" class="">whole</st> <st data-num="01004 05238">storehouse</st>, with its <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st>, <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>, <st data-num="01314" class="">spices</st>, and <st data-num="02896" class="">high quality</st> <st data-num="08081" class="">olive oil</st>, as well as his <st data-num="01004 03627">armory</st> and <st data-num="03605 0834 04672">everything</st> in his <st data-num="0214" class="">treasuries</st>. <st data-num="02396" class="">Hezekiah</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">showed</st> them <st data-num="03808 01961 01697 0834 03808">everything</st> in his <st data-num="01004" class="">palace</st> and in his <st data-num="03605" class="">whole</st> <st data-num="04474" class="">kingdom</st>.<n id="2" />

<st data-num="03470" class="">Isaiah</st> the <st data-num="05030" class="">prophet</st> <st data-num="0935 0413">visited</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="02396" class="">Hezekiah</st> and <st data-num="0559 0413">asked</st> him, “<st data-num="04100" class="">What</st> did <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">say</st>? <st data-num="0370" class="">Where</st> do they <st data-num="0935 0413">come</st> from?” <st data-num="02396" class="">Hezekiah</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, “They <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> from the <st data-num="07350" class="">distant</st> <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st>.”

Isaiah<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">asked</st>, “<st data-num="04100" class="">What</st> have they <st data-num="07200" class="">seen</st> in your <st data-num="01004" class="">palace</st>?” <st data-num="02396" class="">Hezekiah</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, “They have <st data-num="07200" class="">seen</st> <st data-num="03605 0834">everything</st> in my <st data-num="01004" class="">palace</st>. I <st data-num="07200" class="">showed</st> them <st data-num="03808 01961 01697 0834 03808">everything</st><n id="2" /> in my <st data-num="0214" class="">treasuries</st>.”
Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Listen to the Lord’s message,
‘Look, a time is coming when everything in your palace and the things your ancestors have accumulated to this day will be carried away to Babylon; nothing will be left,’ says the Lord.

‘Some of your very own <st data-num="01121" class="">descendants</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st> you <st data-num="03318 04480 0834 03205">father</st><n id="1" /> will be <st data-num="03947" class="">taken away</st> and will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> made <st data-num="05631" class="">eunuchs</st> in the <st data-num="01964" class="">palace</st> of the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st>.’”
Hezekiah said to Isaiah, “The Lord’s message which you have announced is appropriate.” Then he added, “At least there will be peace and stability during my lifetime.”

The rest of the events of Hezekiah’s reign and all his accomplishments, including how he built a pool and conduit to bring water into the city, are recorded in the scroll called the Annals of the Kings of Judah.
Hezekiah passed away and his son Manasseh replaced him as king.
